definition[0]_en: A recording medium that relies on pole reversal in a ferromagnetic medium, typically ferromagnetic oxide particles bound to a tape or a disc.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A recording medium that relies on pole reversal in a ferromagnetic medium, typically ferromagnetic oxide particles bound to a tape or a disc.

definition[0]_en: A recording medium that uses a combination of laser heating with a varying magnetic field to write data to a disc.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A recording medium that uses a combination of laser heating with a varying magnetic field to write data to a disc.

definition[0]_en: A recording medium for recording binary encoded data in a transparent medium with a reflective backing. A laser is used to read the changes in reflectivity as a binary data stream.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A recording medium for recording binary encoded data in a transparent medium with a reflective backing. A laser is used to read the changes in reflectivity as a binary data stream.
